PAD_TadpoleDivine.synopsis: This VB plays after attempting to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. She confesses that there's something special about it and she can't remove it.Will play on the player who leaves the dialog that reveals this fact, but characters can be fairly opinionated here since they are reacting to knowledge.Up to two characters.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The session 'PAD_TadpoleDivine' contains a synopsis note that it plays after the attempt to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. This indicates an implicit ordering constraint: the player must first trigger the event of trying to remove the tadpole before 'PAD_TadpoleDivine' can occur. Since we do not have a named session for the predecessor event in the provided data, we denote this predecessor descriptively.

predecessor: Attempt to get Ethel to remove the tadpole

PAD_TadpoleDivine_1.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine_1.text: The tadpole was tampered with? That complicates things...

PAD_TadpoleDivine_0.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine_0.text: Tampered or not, we need to get these things out of our heads. Let's find another way.
